pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, February 22, 2019 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

St. John’s, Newfoundland and Labrador

10:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will visit the new Core Science Facility site at Memorial University to highlight an investment in the science, research, and education infrastructure project, and will deliver remarks. A media availability will follow. Minister of Indigenous Services Seamus O’Regan will be in attendance.

Core Science Facility
Memorial University of Newfoundland
Arctic Avenue

Notes for media:

    • Open coverage
    • Media should arrive to the stairwell closest to Arctic Avenue and Sandpits Road no later than 9:45 a.m.
    • Parking will be available on the first floor of the parking garage directly across from the Core Science Facility.
    • Personal protective equipment will not be required, however media will be required to remain within the designated safety zone.

1:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with Premier of Newfoundland and Labrador Dwight Ball and visit the House of Assembly.

Confederation Building
Newfoundland and Labrador House of Assembly
100 Prince Philip Drive

Notes for media:

    • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting
    • Media are asked to arrive no later than 1:15 p.m.

Toronto, Ontario

6:00 p.m. The Prime Minister and Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Ahmed Hussen will meet members of Operation Black Vote.

Closed to media.
